p: The first reports of SARS coronavirus infection were published in 2003, and the causative agent was subsequently characterised as a novel human coronavirus [ 23]. The SARS epidemic was halted by a highly effective global public health response coordinated by the World Health Organization, and there is no further evidence that SARS CoV is currently circulating in humans. However, the SARS outbreak focused renewed attention on coronaviruses generally, resulting in the discovery of two more new human coronaviruses, NL63 and HKU1.
